column7: Typo – Please consider this to be a Global correction across all dictionaries.
Typo – Please note that generally the meaning given here is written as a single word. You may consider making this a Global Correction across all dictionaries.
Typo – Please note that the general usage is without the hyphen. Therefore, please consider this to be a Global Correction across all dictionaries.

Typo – You may consider to make this a Global Correction using the target search: " ddaṣadi"  ——becomes—–  " dṛṣadi" • the initial space surrounding the target search " ddaṣadi" is required to avoid ativyāpti, which I am sure will delight Andhrabharati, by my mention. The form: " ddaṣadi" in every single occurrence can only be this: " dṛṣadi" – There is no other possible correct combination of these letters.
Typo – Since the uttarapada here is spelled: "guñjā", why suddenly be "lazy" with transliteration by spelling the definition as: "gunja"?
Typo – Please note that this correction follows MW dictionary, and seems to be the more correct form.

Typo – I hope that Andhrabharati will clarify the spelling of this Headword. Apte Dictionary gives: "ardhacandrākṛti" ; while MW gives "ardhacandrākṛta". The question for Andhrabharati is this: "Are both forms correct?" OR is one of the two forms incorrect?

Typo – I hope that Andhrabharati will clarify the spelling of this Headword. Apte Dictionary gives: "ardhacandrākṛti" ; while MW gives "ardhacandrākṛta". The question for Andhrabharati is this: "Are both forms correct?" OR is one of the two forms incorrect?
Typo – Please note that the "hyphen" is always required here. Therefore, this could be a Global correction across all dictionaries.
